head.title: Days
head.firstline: Daughters of Time, the hypocritic Days

notes.note: Først trykt i tidsskriftet Atlantic Monthly, 1857.
,,Daughters of Time'' er i visse udgaver erstattet med ,,Damsels of Time'', men førstnævnte version er den almindeligste.

body.poetry: Daughters of Time, the hypocritic Days Muffled and dumb like barefoot dervishes And marching single in an endless file, Bring diadems and fagots in their hands. To each they offer gifts after his will, Bread, kingdom, stars, and sky that holds them all. I, in my pleached garden, watched the pomp, Forgot my morning wishes, hastily Took a few herbs and apples, and the Day Turned and departed silent. I, too late Under her solemn fillet saw the scorn.
